<!DOCTYPE publaw SYSTEM "cq-dscs-exchange-publaw.dtd"> <publaw bill-num="hr3684" congress="117" corrected-print="no" document-type="enr" pl-num="117-58" public-private="public" session="1" stat-page="429" stat-vol="135" version-date="20211115"> Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act Passenger Rail Expansion and Rail Safety Act of 2021 Digital Equity Act of 2021 Telecommunications Skilled Workforce Act Wildland Fire Mitigation and Management Commission Act of 2021 Repairing Existing Public Land by Adding Necessary Trees Act REPLANT Act Public Law 117-58 135 STAT. 429 117th Congress November 15, 2021 [H. R. 3684] AN ACT To authorize funds for Federal-aid highways, highway safety programs, and transit programs, and for other purposes.

<clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB84AB216E964448294FC6D9A1F0504D3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) Treatment Amounts made available under clause (i) shall be available for obligation in the same manner as if those amounts were apportioned under chapter 1 of title 23, United States Code. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H106764AAA2624D8F946E6FC82310327A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (G) Nationally significant Federal lands and Tribal projects <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE9DD3BABFA1F46C38D1C416D010D6231" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) In general To carry out the nationally significant Federal lands and tribal projects program under section 1123 of the FAST Act (23 U.S.C. 201 note; Public Law 114–94), $55,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2022 through 2026.

<clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFEFEAF70EA264E4D8632FF19296F1700" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) Allocation Amounts made available under clause (i) shall be allocated in the same manner as if made available under paragraph (1)(A). <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFFD8D1CA4B5E4DF2AEFAF2250228C164" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) Nationally significant Federal lands and Tribal projects program In addition to amounts made available under paragraph (1)(G), there is authorized to be appropriated to carry out section 1123 of the FAST Act (23 U.S.C. 201 note; Public Law 114–94) $300,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2022 through 2026.

<subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6D6F01AD869F45DD9888287F8232CFEE" qb-display-quote="yes"> (e) Disadvantaged business enterprises <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBBFB02832ECA4686A3C898DF51CE89D8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) Findings Congress finds that— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5BCDD1BFD12042DCB1B24AC3A1084D66" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) while significant progress has occurred due to the establishment of the disadvantaged business enterprise program, discrimination and related barriers continue to pose significant obstacles for minority- and women-owned businesses seeking to do business in Federally assisted surface transportation markets across the United States; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE067163486C74EFEA568980E01DE0CE7" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) the continuing barriers described in subparagraph (A) merit the continuation of the disadvantaged business enterprise program; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA19BC43CCEDB44F0A22C242CDF78C5CF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) Congress has received and reviewed testimony and documentation of race and gender discrimination from numerous sources, including congressional hearings and roundtables, scientific reports, reports issued by public and private agencies, news stories, reports of discrimination by organizations and individuals, and discrimination lawsuits, which show that race- and gender-neutral efforts alone are insufficient to address the problem; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE85B9C255D4F4FDCBE3AE839D862A3C8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) the testimony and documentation described in subparagraph (C) demonstrate that discrimination across the United States poses a barrier to full and fair participation in surface transportation-related businesses of women business owners and minority business owners and has impacted firm development and many aspects of surface transportation-related business in the public and private markets; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HADB11116D0054072977D90BBE3B56D45" qb-display-quote="yes"> (E) the testimony and documentation described in subparagraph (C) provide a strong basis that there is a compelling need for the continuation of the disadvantaged business enterprise program to address race and gender discrimination in surface transportation-related business. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDFF8597277974F9CBBBB829C702B717A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Definitions In this subsection: <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H48FBF2D5679549639A7C0D5B97FF1652" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) Small business concern <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H07BF7223EC51495AA1BC7C52606BBEB8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) In general The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">small business concern means a small business concern (as the term is used in section 3 of the Small Business Act (15 U.S.C. 632)).

<clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF875A80834484D0599C693B021877AD8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) Exclusions The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">small business concern does not include any concern or group of concerns controlled by the same socially and economically disadvantaged individual or individuals that have average annual gross receipts during the preceding 3 fiscal years in excess of $26,290,000, as adjusted annually by the Secretary for inflation. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H90EACFE5C8A74E989F6671DF7D537ABE" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) Socially and economically disadvantaged individuals The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">socially and economically disadvantaged individuals has the meaning given the term in section 8(d) of the Small Business Act (15 U.S.C. 637(d)) and relevant subcontracting regulations issued pursuant to that Act, except that women shall be presumed to be socially and economically disadvantaged individuals for purposes of this subsection.

OBLIGATION CEILING <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5544A4438C414C5F919762D137C1BE20" qb-display-quote="yes"> (a) General limitation Subject to subsection (e), and notwithstanding any other provision of law, the obligations for Federal-aid highway and highway safety construction programs shall not exceed— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3F64EAC71129428FB2D182D2E8160944" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) $57,473,430,072 for fiscal year 2022; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3AEF15855E5B49C69FE5A65EC54DE19B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) $58,764,510,674 for fiscal year 2023; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2617DE62CED04F9FAF59C214929965E2" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) $60,095,782,888 for fiscal year 2024; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE8C12F1336804DF79FB510F0E292147D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) $61,314,170,545 for fiscal year 2025; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H324D59B2584D42F288E1F98DDCABED85" qb-display-quote="yes"> (5) $62,657,105,821 for fiscal year 2026. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC4E5E0EF326842D6A9C50954CABA325D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (b) Exceptions The limitations under subsection (a) shall not apply to obligations under or for— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF646C449360D4AC7B1AAD1BC67A92FE7" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) section 125 of title 23, United States Code; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCD044C28D7E94316A86B3E2FCCE01775" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) section 147 of the Surface Transportation Assistance Act of 1978 (23 U.S.C. 144 note; 92 Stat.

2027); <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6C2E820BC0A74216A1BDFDE0D6BF7DA9" qb-display-quote="yes"> (7) section 157 of title 23, United States Code (as in effect on June 8, 1998); <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF6EF8819C01E4016A6F30CECBE727205" qb-display-quote="yes"> (8) section 105 of title 23, United States Code (as in effect for fiscal years 1998 through 2004, but only in an amount equal to $639,000,000 for each of those fiscal years); <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2F544121CD244F86B7592C6BBC92728D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (9) Federal-aid highway programs for which obligation authority was made available under the Transportation Equity Act for the 21st Century (112 Stat. 107) or subsequent Acts for multiple years or to remain available until expended, but only to the extent that the obligation authority has not lapsed or been used; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0136DE18DF1E4455A52097CD71980B03" qb-display-quote="yes"> (10) section 105 of title 23, United States Code (as in effect for fiscal years 2005 through 2012, but only in an amount equal to $639,000,000 for each of those fiscal years); <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE7A96782DFC54EF1949F6466BD592D65" qb-display-quote="yes"> (11) section 1603 of SAFETEA–LU (23 U.S.C. 118 note; 119 Stat.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC7EABEEE30554912AF45394FA5866F95" qb-display-quote="yes"> (13) section 119 of title 23, United States Code (as in effect for fiscal years 2016 through 2021, but only in an amount equal to $639,000,000 for each of those fiscal years); and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4311567D1CE5421CA5297790D46D26AA" qb-display-quote="yes"> (14) section 119 of title 23, United States Code (but, for fiscal years 2022 through 2026, only in an amount equal to $639,000,000 for each of those fiscal years). <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA558B76758ED48EA86CDFD1F8560BDDB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Distribution of obligation authority For each of fiscal years 2022 through 2026, the Secretary— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H89C0B6471D6A4C6D95A7EBF4B8B56710" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) shall not distribute obligation authority provided by subsection (a) for the fiscal year for— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4A519E1C2A0341C18C138AB92B5F2B82" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) amounts authorized for administrative expenses and programs by section 104(a) of title 23, United States Code; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H02647A8F9FA74EA596E4D7FC903E410C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) amounts authorized for the Bureau of Transportation Statistics; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1A41AABD66C34445B628A36892D4425D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) shall not distribute an amount of obligation authority provided by subsection (a) that is equal to the unobligated balance of amounts— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE87ED0216BE447C4ABD5EEF2401E42E0" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) made available from the Highway Trust Fund (other than the Mass Transit Account) for Federal-aid highway and highway safety construction programs for previous fiscal years the funds for which are allocated by the Secretary (or apportioned by the Secretary under section 202 or 204 of title 23, United States Code); <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H38F83DCA819A42EBAC136EE52A59CF69" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) Selection <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD46E299E152B47FB958C8BA268FF8BDE" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) Application A State seeking to be a participating State shall— <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HAD4ADC5E416149F78146A83EBF2B30BC" qb-display-quote="yes"> (I) submit to the Secretary an application in such form, at such time, and containing such information as the Secretary may require; and <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9F2CE7E063104C05AF738F00923C6A89" qb-display-quote="yes"> (II) have in place adequate financial controls to allow the State to determine the average annual Federal share requirements under the pilot program. <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF99BFE77D66241228BF034E69CF9068B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) Requirement For each of fiscal years 2022 through 2026, the Secretary shall select not more than 10 States to be participating States. .

201 note; Public Law 114–94) $300,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2022 through 2026. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6344209A2078480EAC26D158A7CEBDFE" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) Healthy Streets program There is authorized to be appropriated to carry out the Healthy Streets program under section 11406 $100,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2022 through 2026. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H509E5FE99A814A7A9783A26D6BA0D155" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) Transportation Resilience and Adaptation Centers of Excellence There is authorized to be appropriated to carry out section 520 of title 23, United States Code, $100,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2022 through 2026.

<subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H847738C3FB634108BAE6FAA76E5FAF3E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) Technology and innovation deployment program To carry out section 503(c) of title 23, United States Code, $110,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2022 through 2026. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC3F815E68DF74EC9BF241BD8F01D0CDE" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) Training and education To carry out section 504 of title 23, United States Code— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDA63A27D1E0A4BED9BE5421EE0F1D661" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) $25,000,000 for fiscal year 2022; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H577A811267694275AB0343ACAC3AE5C2" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) $25,250,000 for fiscal year 2023; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5F83C79B80844D24BF1892C9F89B8BC8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iii) $25,500,000 for fiscal year 2024; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H63F0FA71792E42459F341167FF33B296" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iv) $25,750,000 for fiscal year 2025; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HEA2E3813F0A2420983321C825CD0E3FE" qb-display-quote="yes"> (v) $26,000,000 for fiscal year 2026. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6369917384164A37A565EEE4E27EA10C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) Intelligent transportation systems program To carry out sections 512 through 518 of title 23, United States Code, $110,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2022 through 2026.

<subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8AA4927FE8D741868BD7E4BFE58E6037" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) Treatment Amounts made available under subparagraph (A) or (B) shall be available for obligation in the same manner as if those amounts were apportioned under chapter 1 of title 23, United States Code, except that those amounts shall remain available until expended. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6D6F01AD869F45DD9888287F8232CFEE" qb-display-quote="yes"> (e) Disadvantaged business enterprises <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBBFB02832ECA4686A3C898DF51CE89D8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) Findings Congress finds that— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5BCDD1BFD12042DCB1B24AC3A1084D66" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) while significant progress has occurred due to the establishment of the disadvantaged business enterprise program, discrimination and related barriers continue to pose significant obstacles for minority- and women-owned businesses seeking to do business in Federally assisted surface transportation markets across the United States; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE067163486C74EFEA568980E01DE0CE7" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) the continuing barriers described in subparagraph (A) merit the continuation of the disadvantaged business enterprise program; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA19BC43CCEDB44F0A22C242CDF78C5CF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) Congress has received and reviewed testimony and documentation of race and gender discrimination from numerous sources, including congressional hearings and roundtables, scientific reports, reports issued by public and private agencies, news stories, reports of discrimination by organizations and individuals, and discrimination lawsuits, which show that race- and gender-neutral efforts alone are insufficient to address the problem; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE85B9C255D4F4FDCBE3AE839D862A3C8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) the testimony and documentation described in subparagraph (C) demonstrate that discrimination across the United States poses a barrier to full and fair participation in surface transportation-related businesses of women business owners and minority business owners and has impacted firm development and many aspects of surface transportation-related business in the public and private markets; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HADB11116D0054072977D90BBE3B56D45" qb-display-quote="yes"> (E) the testimony and documentation described in subparagraph (C) provide a strong basis that there is a compelling need for the continuation of the disadvantaged business enterprise program to address race and gender discrimination in surface transportation-related business. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDFF8597277974F9CBBBB829C702B717A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Definitions In this subsection: <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H48FBF2D5679549639A7C0D5B97FF1652" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) Small business concern <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H07BF7223EC51495AA1BC7C52606BBEB8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) In general The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">small business concern means a small business concern (as the term is used in section 3 of the Small Business Act (15 U.S.C.

<clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H106D46B27B624933923AA97697330C15" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) a justification for advancing the activities described in clause (i), including an assessment of the effects to the project scope, schedule, and budget if the request is not approved; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB6EA11A066A94DD2A53D5D5B7A984E10" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iii) the level of risk of the activities described in clause (i).

<subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5F827B29610E4DC3BB53FD7AF302EF12" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) by inserting after paragraph (8) the following: <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="H817F08CA8B2B487BB1FDC3B263C9B651" style="OLC"> <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6219955A9DD246C28D93F6F0FE277D61" qb-display-quote="yes"> (9) Safe system approach The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">safe system approach means a roadway design— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5C7937CD0E3B43769294A45069B7B797" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) that emphasizes minimizing the risk of injury or fatality to road users; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H32E9AE096AD448D0A36EB045C4221445" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) that— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3FE0F35890104A2AB7F440A7BA1BB1C3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) takes into consideration the possibility and likelihood of human error; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0CA0145A17D34AD3ABE78C54E8034FA7" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) accommodates human injury tolerance by taking into consideration likely accident types, resulting impact forces, and the ability of the human body to withstand impact forces; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4C2C1CE40A9041189E66525872E0DB45" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iii) takes into consideration vulnerable road users. ; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4436CFC378AF4E6BBF0E70331CB2ABBA" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) by inserting after paragraph (10) (as so redesignated) the following: <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="H693D87AC88EC4F97AA6752118E0FA50F" style="OLC"> <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HEA2499AD570F41328676BBCC317E56C7" qb-display-quote="yes"> (11) Specified safety project <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H47A127EF125843EFA2B6DA42BD07F7F6" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) In general The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">specified safety project means a project carried out for the purpose of safety under any other section of this title that is consistent with the State strategic highway safety plan.

<subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE2F9A700C166492A87A880C50DBFB90C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) Requirements <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H963A8441DDE64D81BCF3EC3C829F59B9" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) Maximum Federal share Subject to clause (iii), the Federal share of the cost of an individual project carried out under a program described in subparagraph (A) by a participating State and to which the participating State is applying the Federal share requirements under the pilot program may be up to 100 percent. <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD64DDBD9B1D5419E92070A6A52ABBBA7" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) Minimum Federal share No individual project carried out under a program described in subparagraph (A) by a participating State and to which the participating State is applying the Federal share requirements under the pilot program shall have a Federal share of 0 percent. <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDA14BBD11B3543E0A7D9F7818A8061F4" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iii) Determination The average annual Federal share of the total cost of all projects authorized under a program described in subparagraph (A) to which a participating State is applying the Federal share requirements under the pilot program shall be not more than the average of the maximum Federal share of those projects if those projects were not carried out under the pilot program.

<subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H38F83DCA819A42EBAC136EE52A59CF69" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) Selection <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD46E299E152B47FB958C8BA268FF8BDE" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) Application A State seeking to be a participating State shall— <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HAD4ADC5E416149F78146A83EBF2B30BC" qb-display-quote="yes"> (I) submit to the Secretary an application in such form, at such time, and containing such information as the Secretary may require; and <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9F2CE7E063104C05AF738F00923C6A89" qb-display-quote="yes"> (II) have in place adequate financial controls to allow the State to determine the average annual Federal share requirements under the pilot program. <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF99BFE77D66241228BF034E69CF9068B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) Requirement For each of fiscal years 2022 through 2026, the Secretary shall select not more than 10 States to be participating States. .

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9AE30845B9A94E6BA46957DA0E1CEC5F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) Applicability of title 23, United States Code Amounts authorized to be appropriated by paragraph (1) shall— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7D78D202B4864564A80A958BB5B75A98" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) be available for obligation in the same manner as if those funds were apportioned under chapter 1 of title 23, United States Code, except that the Federal share of the cost of a project or activity carried out using those funds shall be 80 percent, unless otherwise expressly provided by this division (including the amendments by this division) or otherwise determined by the Secretary; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC6B0882A92214D6ABF8643E116786761" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) remain available until expended and not be transferable, except as otherwise provided by this division. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3CB34F22A7404F66AECE14332A7859FD" qb-display-quote="yes"> (d) Pilot programs The following amounts are authorized to be appropriated out of the Highway Trust Fund (other than the Mass Transit Account): <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9387C820EB404BC4B82EEEBE24574467" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) Wildlife crossings pilot program For the wildlife crossings pilot program under section 171 of title 23, United States Code— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1D2DC9C07D744077908E922EF43C5BFA" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) $60,000,000 for fiscal year 2022; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC48AF9A357834DBD87007FADAC621502" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) $65,000,000 for fiscal year 2023; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H09529CD35D394EE7B8506C1694722FB8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) $70,000,000 for fiscal year 2024; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCA9E917B23F1404F91326CA58AE6A077" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) $75,000,000 for fiscal year 2025; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H963321578C82457591902DE82B1582E7" qb-display-quote="yes"> (E) $80,000,000 for fiscal year 2026. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1E08CFA45F48484E9D24ED7E52F64538" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Prioritization process pilot program <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HEC5D2149496A40D68D0AE926C2BEA94A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) In general For the prioritization process pilot program under section 11204, $10,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2022 through 2026.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H95907E28644241D686793BA84425DB8B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (5) Uniform certification <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H576F4C3907E24224B5A23B9B974F5393" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) In general The Secretary shall establish minimum uniform criteria for use by State governments in certifying whether a concern qualifies as a small business concern for the purpose of this subsection. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6401DA4BF7CD42F68CCFD5E7151603E2" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) Inclusions The minimum uniform criteria established under subparagraph (A) shall include, with respect to a potential small business concern— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE49F1F06481541569152A93F5E51E72D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) on-site visits; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF9849CF6840E4B00A2BF001682DE9357" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) personal interviews with personnel; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H20566C27C9B542F58E3D6413D3FD6493" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iii) issuance or inspection of licenses; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE0B246F37F394ADB9163C23E4F6CF1EC" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iv) analyses of stock ownership; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H82DDCCBD579E4FC6A38510E14A47F63F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (v) listings of equipment; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCD92ED88472A4E739963C942ECB61A55" qb-display-quote="yes"> (vi) analyses of bonding capacity; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA2AE00584B05419E9EC6B0012287B71A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (vii) listings of work completed; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC9612450F6364B5F8F944FDE1468D07C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (viii) examination of the resumes of principal owners; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H96963B6007A5452AAB69F2B3CE95A16A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ix) analyses of financial capacity; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4D4B4F8CE91A47DEB7BD41D65B386B1B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (x) analyses of the type of work preferred. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3427FEEF449A41F49719504762E9994C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (6) Reporting The Secretary shall establish minimum requirements for use by State governments in reporting to the Secretary— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4D365F36745E41B58DE2B26A76C04AA0" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) information concerning disadvantaged business enterprise awards, commitments, and achievements; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFCF2BE01D0284A968C07BFFF7981A876" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) such other information as the Secretary determines to be appropriate for the proper monitoring of the disadvantaged business enterprise program.

; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6DE075BB5D394E9984EC45DC6AC3BA55" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) by inserting after paragraph (23) (as so redesignated) the following: <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="HE856BE3D3D7A4A89A4203CBBB823E873" style="OLC"> <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9E55477A819042D49FF1D5BDBB046943" qb-display-quote="yes"> (24) Resilience The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">resilience, with respect to a project, means a project with the ability to anticipate, prepare for, or adapt to conditions or withstand, respond to, or recover rapidly from disruptions, including the ability— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H62680BC545CF4E108FD805CD0289A6DA" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9ED46DC1AC214880B38249E1BBCF9035" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) to resist hazards or withstand impacts from weather events and natural disasters; or <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H86C56D6606114154BC97ECF142E18E03" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) to reduce the magnitude or duration of impacts of a disruptive weather event or natural disaster on a project; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD8B09331E0B347D7A0E15744DA4D1EF7" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) to have the absorptive capacity, adaptive capacity, and recoverability to decrease project vulnerability to weather events or other natural disasters. ; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H888679D8329F4A84B672B296D740581D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (5) in subparagraph (A) of paragraph (32) (as so redesignated)— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H41E118E3849A47698943337090F793A8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) by striking the period at the end and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6313D8050E5F4C91B435A39B9378AEDE" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) by striking subparagraph (B) and inserting the following: <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="H0957CCF0514F4A489456616137E64E73" style="OLC"> <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H65885E5D3D06455BB9A530F15693BF3E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) Guaranteed amounts The initial amounts resulting from the calculation under subparagraph (A) shall be adjusted to ensure that each State receives an aggregate apportionment that is— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCC3526997A014132B18397D58BB50BF2" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) equal to at least 95 percent of the estimated tax payments paid into the Highway Trust Fund (other than the Mass Transit Account) in the most recent fiscal year for which data are available that are— <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9FFB99DBDC6443DDAE2548033332D0F4" qb-display-quote="yes"> (I) attributable to highway users in the State; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HAFBD72B3255F446EBA29AFB7EAC82F77" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iii) at least 1 percent greater than the apportionment that the State received for the previous fiscal year. ; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H35A9BF0D91FF4A1FB2555A4B7FAE7CF8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) by striking paragraph (2). <section display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1F5678A1092844AD97A6DD92E001E01C" qb-display-quote="yes" section-type="subsequent-section"> 11105.

; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9A3328FB9A2B4106873E0EAC9AE66001" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) in subsection (e)(4)(D), by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">analysis and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">analyses, both of which shall take into consideration extreme weather and resilience; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8DD727A42C724D1A9864FF67FEB41B84" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) by adding at the end the following: <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="H66773E1B1D7D4104ADCBA5D752C61D1B" style="OLC"> <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0D3C6856566D4C2880E2C54DECD365F4" qb-display-quote="yes"> (k) Protective features <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCE3B4CB17EEF4CB1B970166DC7D40BFB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) In general A State may use not more than 15 percent of the funds apportioned to the State under section 104(b)(1) for each fiscal year for 1 or more protective features on a Federal-aid highway or bridge not on the National Highway System, if the protective feature is designed to mitigate the risk of recurring damage or the cost of future repairs from extreme weather events, flooding, or other natural disasters. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H67C4FF80A72143D99A6094988474AAFE" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Protective features described A protective feature referred to in paragraph (1) includes— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HAC4CD7CA7BC44D8FBE9862F1955A8E7C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) raising roadway grades; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H40E15289A46349F29FAF1202869C6D78" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) relocating roadways in a base floodplain to higher ground above projected flood elevation levels or away from slide prone areas; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H96F1A06EAEF043EFBC8B409822E7FB0C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) stabilizing slide areas; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0060CA891B6343F3B1F0C8D28671938A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) stabilizing slopes; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB01A89A6062F445A82951A34615E80CD" qb-display-quote="yes"> (E) lengthening or raising bridges to increase waterway openings; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9D8BE9CA40114C4EB92A4F460F062628" qb-display-quote="yes"> (F) increasing the size or number of drainage structures; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8CAE4ED12F01485DA5BF75BDD818D827" qb-display-quote="yes"> (G) replacing culverts with bridges or upsizing culverts; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3E451A4B96C94D1E9131F208E324FF47" qb-display-quote="yes"> (H) installing seismic retrofits on bridges; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC51F9380B73A4FF8A10E6291AD225742" qb-display-quote="yes"> (I) adding scour protection at bridges, installing riprap, or adding other scour, stream stability, coastal, or other hydraulic countermeasures, including spur dikes; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H586C65E364CB487E9A89E669AB8AE509" qb-display-quote="yes"> (J) the use of natural infrastructure to mitigate the risk of recurring damage or the cost of future repair from extreme weather events, flooding, or other natural disasters. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H71318358A713444F8D5AD74AFBD5EBC5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) Savings provision Nothing in this subsection limits the ability of a State to carry out a project otherwise eligible under subsection (d) using funds apportioned under section 104(b)(1).

and <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1DFBC323578D4B3CBE11C4DC046651F0" qb-display-quote="yes"> (II) is consistent with the State strategic highway safety plan (as defined in section 148(a)); <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3D5448EEA5F54CB5B1B095B610285148" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) the non-Federal share for a project under this subsection may be calculated on a project, multiple-project, or program basis; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE83BBDA3FB77413897477B198B5B41C7" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iii) the Federal share of the cost of an individual project in this section may be up to 100 percent. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0FC477F103A04B4EA8260DFE058B0656" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) Requirement Subparagraph (B) shall only apply to a State if the State has adequate financial controls, as certified by the Secretary, to account for the average annual non-Federal share under this paragraph.

and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1E9290475A6C44EEB2EED6D1F8A9098A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">except that the total Federal and inserting the following: <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="HB78888998D0E454EA372D90D7796C316" style="OLC"> except that— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H33D8BBD49FCF4A1CB763A1B674EEF1EC" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) for a State with a population density of not more than 80 persons per square mile of land area, based on the 2010 census, the maximum share of the total Federal assistance provided for a project receiving a grant under this section shall be the applicable share under section 120(b); and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBA3E12CDA61743CFBA644EFFECC93F85" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) for a State not described in subparagraph (A), the total Federal ; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H63B175ACCBA442B883E7DEEB90644B14" qb-display-quote="yes"> (11) by redesignating subsections (k) through (n) as subsections (l), (m), (n), and (p), respectively; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7776727D24984949B829970B3AF7FFE3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (12) by inserting after subsection (j) the following: <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="H1E73E4A45B0F41BE9AA5F937559869A5" style="OLC"> <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF1C4F5DA46864E65AFB3634C2D57ABCB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (k) Efficient use of non-Federal funds <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8B217324F53C4050ACB5C4E8BC04E47A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) In general Notwithstanding any other provision of law and subject to approval by the Secretary under paragraph (2)(B), in the case of any grant for a project under this section, during the period beginning on the date on which the grant recipient is selected and ending on the date on which the grant agreement is signed— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H624D022866464275B7D999920E9777B8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) the grant recipient may obligate and expend non-Federal funds with respect to the project for which the grant is provided; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H264BB169CF0E48CE84D3D33AADF94E1C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) any non-Federal funds obligated or expended in accordance with subparagraph (A) shall be credited toward the non-Federal cost share for the project for which the grant is provided. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD8B1E88030044D4E91C954FF9FD14D1E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Requirements <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H06E9C35E310C4A4CA7278F3D831D7B0E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) Application In order to obligate and expend non-Federal funds under paragraph (1), the grant recipient shall submit to the Secretary a request to obligate and expend non-Federal funds under that paragraph, including— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H576C14B574C04A1FB966A7C126CA7737" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) a description of the activities the grant recipient intends to fund; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H106D46B27B624933923AA97697330C15" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) a justification for advancing the activities described in clause (i), including an assessment of the effects to the project scope, schedule, and budget if the request is not approved; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB6EA11A066A94DD2A53D5D5B7A984E10" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iii) the level of risk of the activities described in clause (i).

; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2FEF95F58E7D4E8081291F8E59D19228" qb-display-quote="yes"> (14) by inserting after subsection (n) (as so redesignated) the following: <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="H0287EC25331141839692D76CE67320D1" style="OLC"> <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB53BFEC235554887BCDD71B16B6DD35A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (o) Applicant notification <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H24ACD1051C794DBD930D6624EEAA2F94" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) In general Not later than 60 days after the date on which a grant recipient for a project under this section is selected, the Secretary shall provide to each eligible applicant not selected for that grant a written notification that the eligible applicant was not selected. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF6BE87DB49C649E0B725898B8633E743" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Inclusion A written notification under paragraph (1) shall include an offer for a written or telephonic debrief by the Secretary that will provide— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HED653A7E595C44FFB776ADEFA34FCC56" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) detail on the evaluation of the application of the eligible applicant; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBAAB15FDC62C4F2AA12B6C5A8337E3AF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) an explanation of and guidance on the reasons the application was not selected for a grant under this section. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFA812145C9FA45329B9F0246FCAAC497" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) Response <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB96A1547A4AE4C3EBCA4752EE21E5AAA" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) In general Not later than 30 days after the eligible applicant receives a written notification under paragraph (1), if the eligible applicant opts to receive a debrief described in paragraph (2), the eligible applicant shall notify the Secretary that the eligible applicant is requesting a debrief.

<subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE972FF084B8A4F24871287BA3FF6C048" qb-display-quote="yes"> (S) Implement activities to protect segments of the National Highway System from cybersecurity threats. ; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9A3328FB9A2B4106873E0EAC9AE66001" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) in subsection (e)(4)(D), by striking <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">analysis and inserting <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">analyses, both of which shall take into consideration extreme weather and resilience; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8DD727A42C724D1A9864FF67FEB41B84" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) by adding at the end the following: <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="H66773E1B1D7D4104ADCBA5D752C61D1B" style="OLC"> <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0D3C6856566D4C2880E2C54DECD365F4" qb-display-quote="yes"> (k) Protective features <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCE3B4CB17EEF4CB1B970166DC7D40BFB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) In general A State may use not more than 15 percent of the funds apportioned to the State under section 104(b)(1) for each fiscal year for 1 or more protective features on a Federal-aid highway or bridge not on the National Highway System, if the protective feature is designed to mitigate the risk of recurring damage or the cost of future repairs from extreme weather events, flooding, or other natural disasters. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H67C4FF80A72143D99A6094988474AAFE" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Protective features described A protective feature referred to in paragraph (1) includes— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HAC4CD7CA7BC44D8FBE9862F1955A8E7C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) raising roadway grades; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H40E15289A46349F29FAF1202869C6D78" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) relocating roadways in a base floodplain to higher ground above projected flood elevation levels or away from slide prone areas; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H96F1A06EAEF043EFBC8B409822E7FB0C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) stabilizing slide areas; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H0060CA891B6343F3B1F0C8D28671938A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) stabilizing slopes; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB01A89A6062F445A82951A34615E80CD" qb-display-quote="yes"> (E) lengthening or raising bridges to increase waterway openings; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9D8BE9CA40114C4EB92A4F460F062628" qb-display-quote="yes"> (F) increasing the size or number of drainage structures; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8CAE4ED12F01485DA5BF75BDD818D827" qb-display-quote="yes"> (G) replacing culverts with bridges or upsizing culverts; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3E451A4B96C94D1E9131F208E324FF47" qb-display-quote="yes"> (H) installing seismic retrofits on bridges; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC51F9380B73A4FF8A10E6291AD225742" qb-display-quote="yes"> (I) adding scour protection at bridges, installing riprap, or adding other scour, stream stability, coastal, or other hydraulic countermeasures, including spur dikes; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H586C65E364CB487E9A89E669AB8AE509" qb-display-quote="yes"> (J) the use of natural infrastructure to mitigate the risk of recurring damage or the cost of future repair from extreme weather events, flooding, or other natural disasters.

and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBA3E12CDA61743CFBA644EFFECC93F85" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) for a State not described in subparagraph (A), the total Federal ; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H63B175ACCBA442B883E7DEEB90644B14" qb-display-quote="yes"> (11) by redesignating subsections (k) through (n) as subsections (l), (m), (n), and (p), respectively; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7776727D24984949B829970B3AF7FFE3" qb-display-quote="yes"> (12) by inserting after subsection (j) the following: <quoted-block display-end-quotes="yes" display-inline="no-display-inline" display-quotes="yes" id="H1E73E4A45B0F41BE9AA5F937559869A5" style="OLC"> <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF1C4F5DA46864E65AFB3634C2D57ABCB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (k) Efficient use of non-Federal funds <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8B217324F53C4050ACB5C4E8BC04E47A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) In general Notwithstanding any other provision of law and subject to approval by the Secretary under paragraph (2)(B), in the case of any grant for a project under this section, during the period beginning on the date on which the grant recipient is selected and ending on the date on which the grant agreement is signed— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H624D022866464275B7D999920E9777B8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) the grant recipient may obligate and expend non-Federal funds with respect to the project for which the grant is provided; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H264BB169CF0E48CE84D3D33AADF94E1C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) any non-Federal funds obligated or expended in accordance with subparagraph (A) shall be credited toward the non-Federal cost share for the project for which the grant is provided. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD8B1E88030044D4E91C954FF9FD14D1E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Requirements <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H06E9C35E310C4A4CA7278F3D831D7B0E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) Application In order to obligate and expend non-Federal funds under paragraph (1), the grant recipient shall submit to the Secretary a request to obligate and expend non-Federal funds under that paragraph, including— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H576C14B574C04A1FB966A7C126CA7737" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) a description of the activities the grant recipient intends to fund; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H106D46B27B624933923AA97697330C15" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) a justification for advancing the activities described in clause (i), including an assessment of the effects to the project scope, schedule, and budget if the request is not approved; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB6EA11A066A94DD2A53D5D5B7A984E10" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iii) the level of risk of the activities described in clause (i). <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H78F03A402D6941BA9A55D92ACA0AD57D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) Approval The Secretary shall approve or disapprove each request submitted under subparagraph (A).

<subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBF84C5B584E143D8B4D6A6608BC7912E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) Applicability This paragraph applies to all projects described in subparagraph (A) that the Secretary selects on or after October 1, 2021. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA00F157C260845FAB9EE763D6E09757A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Comptroller general <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HAFEA660521344625A6FF3B99F09D1320" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) Assessment The Comptroller General of the United States shall conduct an assessment of the establishment, solicitation, selection, and justification process with respect to the funding of projects under this section. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4EABBDFBF3AE4DB8947DD5D38A4817BF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) Report Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of the Surface Transportation Reauthorization Act of 2021 and annually thereafter, the Comptroller General of the United States shall submit to the Committee on Environment and Public Works of the Senate and the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure of the House of Representatives a report that describes, for each project selected to receive funding under this section— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7201736E35684D6687FDBC87F82CB357" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) the process by which each project was selected; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H00CCEEC22EA84E728CFF344FBA3F5815" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) the factors that went into the selection of each project; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H518152D37BC84DB89518F139188AE9FA" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iii) the justification for the selection of each project based on any criteria established by the Secretary in accordance with this section.

<subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4EABBDFBF3AE4DB8947DD5D38A4817BF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) Report Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of the Surface Transportation Reauthorization Act of 2021 and annually thereafter, the Comptroller General of the United States shall submit to the Committee on Environment and Public Works of the Senate and the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure of the House of Representatives a report that describes, for each project selected to receive funding under this section— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7201736E35684D6687FDBC87F82CB357" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) the process by which each project was selected; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H00CCEEC22EA84E728CFF344FBA3F5815" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) the factors that went into the selection of each project; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H518152D37BC84DB89518F139188AE9FA" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iii) the justification for the selection of each project based on any criteria established by the Secretary in accordance with this section. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H30D6A8EF478648CE8B132B4A80FFA1CC" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) Inspector general Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of the Surface Transportation Reauthorization Act of 2021 and annually thereafter, the Inspector General of the Department of Transportation shall— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE9121535A947470686298B355ECE38C6" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) conduct an assessment of the establishment, solicitation, selection, and justification process with respect to the funding of projects under this section; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H879DDE83C32D4BF4AE2B61771AFEA94A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) submit to the Committee on Environment and Public Works of the Senate and the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure of the House of Representatives a final report that describes the findings of the Inspector General of the Department of Transportation with respect to the assessment conducted under subparagraph (A). <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H2328643A83CD409BABDD54A46672D254" qb-display-quote="yes"> (q) State incentives pilot program <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBBE59CBD9A4F4A2FB33F8D11B8198D1E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) Establishment There is established a pilot program to award grants to eligible applicants for projects eligible for grants under this section (referred to in this subsection as the <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">pilot program).

<clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDA14BBD11B3543E0A7D9F7818A8061F4" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iii) Determination The average annual Federal share of the total cost of all projects authorized under a program described in subparagraph (A) to which a participating State is applying the Federal share requirements under the pilot program shall be not more than the average of the maximum Federal share of those projects if those projects were not carried out under the pilot program. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H38F83DCA819A42EBAC136EE52A59CF69" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) Selection <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD46E299E152B47FB958C8BA268FF8BDE" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) Application A State seeking to be a participating State shall— <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HAD4ADC5E416149F78146A83EBF2B30BC" qb-display-quote="yes"> (I) submit to the Secretary an application in such form, at such time, and containing such information as the Secretary may require; and <subclause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9F2CE7E063104C05AF738F00923C6A89" qb-display-quote="yes"> (II) have in place adequate financial controls to allow the State to determine the average annual Federal share requirements under the pilot program. <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF99BFE77D66241228BF034E69CF9068B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) Requirement For each of fiscal years 2022 through 2026, the Secretary shall select not more than 10 States to be participating States.

<paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H95907E28644241D686793BA84425DB8B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (5) Uniform certification <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H576F4C3907E24224B5A23B9B974F5393" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) In general The Secretary shall establish minimum uniform criteria for use by State governments in certifying whether a concern qualifies as a small business concern for the purpose of this subsection. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6401DA4BF7CD42F68CCFD5E7151603E2" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) Inclusions The minimum uniform criteria established under subparagraph (A) shall include, with respect to a potential small business concern— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE49F1F06481541569152A93F5E51E72D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) on-site visits; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF9849CF6840E4B00A2BF001682DE9357" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) personal interviews with personnel; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H20566C27C9B542F58E3D6413D3FD6493" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iii) issuance or inspection of licenses; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE0B246F37F394ADB9163C23E4F6CF1EC" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iv) analyses of stock ownership; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H82DDCCBD579E4FC6A38510E14A47F63F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (v) listings of equipment; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCD92ED88472A4E739963C942ECB61A55" qb-display-quote="yes"> (vi) analyses of bonding capacity; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA2AE00584B05419E9EC6B0012287B71A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (vii) listings of work completed; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC9612450F6364B5F8F944FDE1468D07C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (viii) examination of the resumes of principal owners; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H96963B6007A5452AAB69F2B3CE95A16A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ix) analyses of financial capacity; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4D4B4F8CE91A47DEB7BD41D65B386B1B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (x) analyses of the type of work preferred. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3427FEEF449A41F49719504762E9994C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (6) Reporting The Secretary shall establish minimum requirements for use by State governments in reporting to the Secretary— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4D365F36745E41B58DE2B26A76C04AA0" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) information concerning disadvantaged business enterprise awards, commitments, and achievements; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFCF2BE01D0284A968C07BFFF7981A876" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) such other information as the Secretary determines to be appropriate for the proper monitoring of the disadvantaged business enterprise program.

and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H264BB169CF0E48CE84D3D33AADF94E1C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) any non-Federal funds obligated or expended in accordance with subparagraph (A) shall be credited toward the non-Federal cost share for the project for which the grant is provided. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD8B1E88030044D4E91C954FF9FD14D1E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Requirements <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H06E9C35E310C4A4CA7278F3D831D7B0E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) Application In order to obligate and expend non-Federal funds under paragraph (1), the grant recipient shall submit to the Secretary a request to obligate and expend non-Federal funds under that paragraph, including— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H576C14B574C04A1FB966A7C126CA7737" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) a description of the activities the grant recipient intends to fund; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H106D46B27B624933923AA97697330C15" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) a justification for advancing the activities described in clause (i), including an assessment of the effects to the project scope, schedule, and budget if the request is not approved; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HB6EA11A066A94DD2A53D5D5B7A984E10" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iii) the level of risk of the activities described in clause (i).

<subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H49E7AB8850EC4679A502E640B3A29D1E" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) Compliance with applicable requirements Any non-Federal funds obligated or expended under paragraph (1) shall comply with all applicable requirements, including any requirements included in the grant agreement. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H599EDA63A7C94EBB811709FCE91DEA06" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) Effect The obligation or expenditure of any non-Federal funds in accordance with this subsection shall not— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H7DC70787C4214D0E96F96865C4A647FB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) affect the signing of a grant agreement or other applicable grant procedures with respect to the applicable grant; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H81122ACE9C264232BAFF44EA7746B782" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) Reconnecting communities pilot program <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H97E675977D9B44D48F4501E0E8C2E351" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) Planning grants For planning grants under the reconnecting communities pilot program under section 11509(c), $30,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2022 through 2026. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H916B11DA86E94706B379BC6FDA4D76F4" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) Capital construction grants For capital construction grants under the reconnecting communities pilot program under section 11509(d)— <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC797313CBD444E31AAD495399BE42610" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) $65,000,000 for fiscal year 2022; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8263F77DB515417B8FEFEDCF642658AF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (ii) $68,000,000 for fiscal year 2023; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H613E78CE4210434FAAF4021A774A68FC" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iii) $70,000,000 for fiscal year 2024; <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H51A47CC15F3D4D0297D2FCAA0D18E53F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (iv) $72,000,000 for fiscal year 2025; and <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H19969FB5ECE9427AA5819762B232F03C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (v) $75,000,000 for fiscal year 2026. <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8AA4927FE8D741868BD7E4BFE58E6037" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) Treatment Amounts made available under subparagraph (A) or (B) shall be available for obligation in the same manner as if those amounts were apportioned under chapter 1 of title 23, United States Code, except that those amounts shall remain available until expended.

<subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H8AA4927FE8D741868BD7E4BFE58E6037" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) Treatment Amounts made available under subparagraph (A) or (B) shall be available for obligation in the same manner as if those amounts were apportioned under chapter 1 of title 23, United States Code, except that those amounts shall remain available until expended. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6D6F01AD869F45DD9888287F8232CFEE" qb-display-quote="yes"> (e) Disadvantaged business enterprises <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBBFB02832ECA4686A3C898DF51CE89D8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) Findings Congress finds that— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H5BCDD1BFD12042DCB1B24AC3A1084D66" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) while significant progress has occurred due to the establishment of the disadvantaged business enterprise program, discrimination and related barriers continue to pose significant obstacles for minority- and women-owned businesses seeking to do business in Federally assisted surface transportation markets across the United States; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE067163486C74EFEA568980E01DE0CE7" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) the continuing barriers described in subparagraph (A) merit the continuation of the disadvantaged business enterprise program; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA19BC43CCEDB44F0A22C242CDF78C5CF" qb-display-quote="yes"> (C) Congress has received and reviewed testimony and documentation of race and gender discrimination from numerous sources, including congressional hearings and roundtables, scientific reports, reports issued by public and private agencies, news stories, reports of discrimination by organizations and individuals, and discrimination lawsuits, which show that race- and gender-neutral efforts alone are insufficient to address the problem; <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE85B9C255D4F4FDCBE3AE839D862A3C8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (D) the testimony and documentation described in subparagraph (C) demonstrate that discrimination across the United States poses a barrier to full and fair participation in surface transportation-related businesses of women business owners and minority business owners and has impacted firm development and many aspects of surface transportation-related business in the public and private markets; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HADB11116D0054072977D90BBE3B56D45" qb-display-quote="yes"> (E) the testimony and documentation described in subparagraph (C) provide a strong basis that there is a compelling need for the continuation of the disadvantaged business enterprise program to address race and gender discrimination in surface transportation-related business. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDFF8597277974F9CBBBB829C702B717A" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Definitions In this subsection: <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H48FBF2D5679549639A7C0D5B97FF1652" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) Small business concern <clause display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H07BF7223EC51495AA1BC7C52606BBEB8" qb-display-quote="yes"> (i) In general The term <quote quote-display-end="auto" quote-display-start="auto" quote-type="text">small business concern means a small business concern (as the term is used in section 3 of the Small Business Act (15 U.S.C.

1248), to the extent that funds obligated in accordance with that section were not subject to a limitation on obligations at the time at which the funds were initially made available for obligation; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD22953A04797490A813E71D1DDD08AD5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (12) section 119 of title 23, United States Code (as in effect for fiscal years 2013 through 2015, but only in an amount equal to $639,000,000 for each of those fiscal years); <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC7EABEEE30554912AF45394FA5866F95" qb-display-quote="yes"> (13) section 119 of title 23, United States Code (as in effect for fiscal years 2016 through 2021, but only in an amount equal to $639,000,000 for each of those fiscal years); and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4311567D1CE5421CA5297790D46D26AA" qb-display-quote="yes"> (14) section 119 of title 23, United States Code (but, for fiscal years 2022 through 2026, only in an amount equal to $639,000,000 for each of those fiscal years). <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HA558B76758ED48EA86CDFD1F8560BDDB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (c) Distribution of obligation authority For each of fiscal years 2022 through 2026, the Secretary— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H89C0B6471D6A4C6D95A7EBF4B8B56710" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) shall not distribute obligation authority provided by subsection (a) for the fiscal year for— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4A519E1C2A0341C18C138AB92B5F2B82" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) amounts authorized for administrative expenses and programs by section 104(a) of title 23, United States Code; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H02647A8F9FA74EA596E4D7FC903E410C" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) amounts authorized for the Bureau of Transportation Statistics; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1A41AABD66C34445B628A36892D4425D" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) shall not distribute an amount of obligation authority provided by subsection (a) that is equal to the unobligated balance of amounts— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HE87ED0216BE447C4ABD5EEF2401E42E0" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) made available from the Highway Trust Fund (other than the Mass Transit Account) for Federal-aid highway and highway safety construction programs for previous fiscal years the funds for which are allocated by the Secretary (or apportioned by the Secretary under section 202 or 204 of title 23, United States Code); and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H9BE5AF10F6C44E6D8BF6718AF2979608" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) for which obligation authority was provided in a previous fiscal year; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HDDBBB1C218E94CC3873FC27F3EC493FB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (3) shall determine the proportion that— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H4426CE46503E4DB0B39042A79B23F393" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) the obligation authority provided by subsection (a) for the fiscal year, less the aggregate of amounts not distributed under paragraphs (1) and (2) of this subsection; bears to <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFC8C197EF2EA435E8BE3463C0E8EE1BA" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) the total of the sums authorized to be appropriated for the Federal-aid highway and highway safety construction programs (other than sums authorized to be appropriated for provisions of law described in paragraphs (1) through (13) of subsection (b) and sums authorized to be appropriated for section 119 of title 23, United States Code, equal to the amount referred to in subsection (b)(14) for the fiscal year), less the aggregate of the amounts not distributed under paragraphs (1) and (2) of this subsection; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HBA608EBAFDD64578B74EBFB0E6AC99CE" qb-display-quote="yes"> (4) shall distribute the obligation authority provided by subsection (a), less the aggregate amounts not distributed under paragraphs (1) and (2), for each of the programs (other than programs to which paragraph (1) applies) that are allocated by the Secretary under this division and title 23, United States Code, or apportioned by the Secretary under section 202 or 204 of that title, by multiplying— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HFA5B9E9D5C0E461E9B541C7D3FDD77B6" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) the proportion determined under paragraph (3); by <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H77CD17EB033641E6AE362A302217C650" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) the amounts authorized to be appropriated for each such program for the fiscal year; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6A15D985FB79469DA7FB5665D73BB72F" qb-display-quote="yes"> (5) shall distribute the obligation authority provided by subsection (a), less the aggregate amounts not distributed under paragraphs (1) and (2) and the amounts distributed under paragraph (4), for Federal-aid highway and highway safety construction programs that are apportioned by the Secretary under title 23, United States Code (other than the amounts apportioned for the national highway performance program in section 119 of title 23, United States Code, that are exempt from the limitation under subsection (b)(14) and the amounts apportioned under sections 202 and 204 of that title) in the proportion that— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF65E1916D6B449A1B042B1257FECD852" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) amounts authorized to be appropriated for the programs that are apportioned under title 23, United States Code, to each State for the fiscal year; bears to <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H30AD0AD24F5740CC839BE05D32420959" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) the total of the amounts authorized to be appropriated for the programs that are apportioned under title 23, United States Code, to all States for the fiscal year. <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H13AC63CFC797441FA504D43CA58FC145" qb-display-quote="yes"> (d) Redistribution of unused obligation authority Notwithstanding subsection (c), the Secretary shall, after August 1 of each of fiscal years 2022 through 2026— <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H1A18B998DA34469BAC092CC4A02B36AB" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) revise a distribution of the obligation authority made available under subsection (c) if an amount distributed cannot be obligated during that fiscal year; and <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H10FC319915EE40739268AE514D39733B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) redistribute sufficient amounts to those States able to obligate amounts in addition to those previously distributed during that fiscal year, giving priority to those States having large unobligated balances of funds apportioned under sections 144 (as in effect on the day before the date of enactment of MAP–21 (Public Law 112–141; 126 Stat.

1248), to the extent that funds obligated in accordance with that section were not subject to a limitation on obligations at the time at which the funds were initially made available for obligation; <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD22953A04797490A813E71D1DDD08AD5" qb-display-quote="yes"> (12) section 119 of title 23, United States Code (as in effect for fiscal years 2013 through 2015, but only in an amount equal to $639,000,000 for each of those fiscal years); <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HC7EABEEE30554912AF45394FA5866F95" qb-display-quote="yes"> (13) section 119 of title 23, United States Code (as in effect for fiscal years 2016 through 2021, but only in an amount equal to $639,000,000 for each of those fiscal years); <subsection display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H3AE86D289C5C412FAF2E58FD78C0EB79" qb-display-quote="yes"> (e) Applicability of obligation limitations to transportation research programs <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HD1777F2EEC024EC2931BAD9DDF62C377" qb-display-quote="yes"> (1) In general Except as provided in paragraph (2), obligation limitations imposed by subsection (a) shall apply to contract authority for transportation research programs carried out under chapter 5 of title 23, United States Code. <paragraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="H6AABD65E3F734B35B946FE778D787F9B" qb-display-quote="yes"> (2) Exception Obligation authority made available under paragraph (1) shall— <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HCBFABC0C60094C68B17C680F0BE18EEA" qb-display-quote="yes"> (A) remain available for a period of 4 fiscal years; and <subparagraph display-inline="no-display-inline" id="HF953B7DEFB5A41CC851432F544E63763" qb-display-quote="yes"> (B) the Secretary determines will not be allocated to the States (or will not be apportioned to the States under section 204 of title 23, United States Code), and will not be available for obligation, for the fiscal year because of the imposition of any obligation limitation for the fiscal year.
